summary: Paul Merson reignited his disagreement with Andros Townsend after Townsend played only seven minutes in Tottenham's 0-0 draw with Burnley. Merson had initially criticized Townsend's inclusion in the England squad, but later admitted his mistake after Townsend scored a goal for England against Italy. Townsend responded to Merson's criticism on Twitter. However, Merson made another dig at Townsend after Tottenham's recent match.

Chelsea has made a formal offer for FC Tokyo's 22-year-old forward Yoshinori Muto, who has 11 international caps for Japan and has scored 16 goals in 37 appearances for his club. Club president Naoki Ogane stated that the offer is not connected to the sponsorship deal Chelsea signed with Japanese company Yokohama Rubber. Muto said that he has not decided yet whether to join the club. If Muto completes the move, he will join Chelsea's Dutch partner club Vitesse Arnhem on loan next season.

A large-scale study found that babies given antibiotics in the first six months of life are more likely to be fat as toddlers. Finnish researchers compared the weight and height of more than 12,000 healthy two-year-olds with records of antibiotic prescriptions and found that one in five boys and one in ten girls were overweight or obese. Antibiotic exposure before six months of age, or repeatedly during infancy, was associated with increased body mass, particularly in boys. This may contribute to the worldwide childhood obesity epidemic and highlights the importance of judicious use of antibiotics in infancy.

A Buckingham Palace guard slipped on a manhole cover during the Changing of the Guard, an incident captured on camera by tourist David Meadwell. The guard quickly recovered, but the moment was witnessed by many onlookers. The Ministry of Defence declined to comment on the incident. The Changing of the Guard happens daily in the summer and every other day in winter.

The A&E networks are remaking the miniseries "Roots," which originally aired in 1977 to over 100 million viewers. The new version will be simulcast on A&E, Lifetime, and History in 2016. LeVar Burton, who played Kunta Kinte in the original, will co-executive produce the new miniseries, which is described as "original" and "contemporary." It will draw more from Alex Haley's novel, "Roots: The Saga of an American Family," and producers will consult with scholars in African and African-American history.

Police are investigating claims by former royal footman Christopher Lawler that he was pinned to a chair and groped by a male staff member on his first day at Clarence House in January 1978. He claims his complaints were ignored for months before the police were notified. A retired royal aide was reportedly interviewed but denied involvement. The Palace has stated the Royal Household would work ‘exhaustively and co-operatively’ with any police probe, and a police spokesman said it would be inappropriate to comment ‘as investigations continue’.

Jesse and Melissa Meek announced they are expecting a child in a rap video set to the theme song from the '90s television sitcom 'The Fresh Prince of Bel-Air.' The video has been viewed over 1.7 million times on YouTube. At the end of the video, the Meeks share a sonogram of their unborn child. The couple stated it took five takes to film the clip. They also mentioned that another video might be possible after finding out the gender of the child.

A dress worn by Vivien Leigh as Scarlett O'Hara in the 1939 film *Gone With the Wind* was sold at auction for $137,000 by Heritage Auctions in Beverly Hills, California. The gray jacket and skirt ensemble was worn in several key scenes in the movie. Other items from the film were also auctioned, including a straw hat worn by Leigh that sold for $52,500, trousers and a jacket worn by Clark Gable that sold for $55,000, and a black bonnet worn by both Leigh and Olivia De Havilland, which fetched $30,000.

A two-year-old boy fell into the cheetah exhibit at the Cleveland Metroparks Zoo after his parents dangled him over the edge. He was rescued by his parents before firefighters and paramedics arrived. The child suffered minor bumps and bruises and was listed in stable condition at the hospital. The cheetahs did not approach the boy or his parents while in the pit. The zoo plans to press child endangerment charges against the family.

A speed camera in Handsworth, Birmingham, previously used to enforce a 30mph speed limit, was angled at a house. The camera has not been working for over two years since all fixed devices in the West Midlands were switched off in March 2013. A Birmingham City Council spokesman said they were aware of the issue and would take appropriate action. There are no plans to include the camera in a new pilot using digital technology.

Usain Bolt will compete at the IAAF/BTC World Relays in the Bahamas on May 2 and 3 as part of the Jamaican team. Bolt said he is "fit, healthy, and ready to run." JAAA General Secretary Garth Gayle said that Usain was available for selection and added, "We can expect some sprint magic on the track in the Bahamas on 2nd and 3rd May."

Neymar and Dani Alves showed their support for Barcelona’s basketball team, who won 85-80 in the Euro League contest against Real Madrid. Before the international break, Luis Enrique's Barcelona had won their El Clasico contest to move four points clear at the top of La Liga. Neymar helped Brazil beat Chile 1-0 at the Emirates Stadium on Sunday. Neymar and his Barcelona team-mates return to La Liga on Sunday, taking on Celta Vigo.

Italy is experiencing a rising wave of migrants from Africa and the Middle East. The Italian coast guard rescued 8,480 migrants between Friday and Monday and received SOS calls from 20 boats on Monday alone. Save the Children fears 400 migrants could be missing after a ship carrying 550 people capsized, but the Italian coast guard cannot confirm the incident. The International Organization for Migration (IOM) reported that Italy registered more than 10,000 migrants arriving in the first three months of 2015, and at least 480 migrants have died crossing the Mediterranean since the beginning of the year. Most migrants recorded this year come from West Africa, Somalia, and Syria, using Libya as a transit country.

Alexis Sanchez chose to play for Arsenal under manager Arsene Wenger, and has scored 19 goals so far this season. Wenger is unaware of the exact reason Sanchez chose Arsenal over other clubs, such as Liverpool, but is happy with his decision. Wenger believes Sanchez's quick adaptation proves he is one of the best, and has played down speculation linking him with Liverpool winger Raheem Sterling.

Sir Bradley Wiggins will attempt to break cycling's hour record on June 7 at London's Olympic Velodrome, riding the furthest distance in 60 minutes. The current record is 52.491km, set by Australian Rohan Dennis in February. Tickets to watch Wiggins's attempt will go on sale from April 19, and the event will be broadcast live on Sky Sports. Tickets will be sold through Sky Tickets for £49, £39, and £29.

Serena Williams beat Sara Errani in the Fed Cup, but the US were beaten 3-2 and relegated to World Group II. Williams said the match was an “eye-opener” and that she was not as ready for the claycourt season as she thought. Williams's doubles defeat on Sunday blotted an otherwise flawless Fed Cup record. The US captain, Mary Joe Fernandez, said that they have to work harder.

River Plate are interested in signing former forward Radamel Falcao, who has struggled on loan at Manchester United. Vice president Matias Patanian said, 'We dream of Falcao Garcia. The doors are open.' Falcao scored 34 goals in 90 appearances for the Argentine club. He has recently equaled Colombia’s all-time goalscoring record with 24 goals.

In 2015, X Factor finalist and pop star Ella Henderson became the official face of the dry shampoo brand Batiste's "Ready For It" campaign, marking her first brand collaboration. The campaign images show the singer with a variety of hairstyles against a blurred and vibrant city background. The partnership between the artist and the brand was fused together by the MILES agency, and the international campaign launched with a TV advertising campaign featuring the singer's latest single, Mirror Man. Mark Hargreaves, the CEO of Crown Talent & Media Group, commented that the synergies between both artist and brand naturally came together.

Aaron Siler was fatally shot by officer Pablo Torres on March 14 after he 'armed himself with a weapon'. A billboard featuring a photograph of Torres and his dog was erected in Kenosham, Wisconsin, paid for by the Kenosha Professional Police Association. The billboard reads, 'Thank you for your support, Kenosha.' Family and friends of Siler called the billboard 'disrespectful'. The Kenosha Professional Police Association stated that the billboard was meant to thank the community for its support. The investigation into Siler's death continues.

Eight Iranian border guards were killed in clashes with militants near the border with Pakistan. Three militants were killed by Iranian forces in the fighting Monday in the southeastern town of Negur. A militant group called Jaish al Adal claimed responsibility for the attack. The Pakistani government condemned the attack, calling it an "act of terrorism."

Defense Minister Gen Nakatani told Japan's parliament that the Air Self Defense Force (ASDF) had never encountered an extraterrestrial unidentified flying object. When the ASDF detects indications of an unidentified flying object, it scrambles fighter jets if necessary and makes visual observations. They sometimes find birds or flying objects other than aircraft, but Nakatani said he doesn't know of a case of finding an unidentified flying object believed to have come over from anywhere other than Earth.

Passenger Jin Pai, 35, was hospitalized with deep cuts after a toilet he was squatting on in Hefei Xinqiao International Airport broke. He had been squatting because he was worried the seat might not be clean. He was found bleeding on the toilet floor after telephoning his companions for help. Authorities and emergency personnel took the man to a hospital, where he received several dozen stitches on his left leg and buttocks. Police spokesman Bo Chiang reminded people that toilets are for sitting on, not standing on.

Japanese photographer Yûki Aoyama's latest series of images capture teenagers pictured next to their fathers leaping into the air. The images are from the 37-year-old's book, *Daughter and Salary Man,* and allow the father to express his fun side. Very little is known about the photos, but they are drumming up plenty of interest online.

Paul Downton, England's managing director, was dismissed. Kevin Pietersen posed for the Surrey team photo at the KIA Oval before the start of the new campaign and joked with photographers. Pietersen, controversially axed by Downton in 2014, has rejoined Surrey in an attempt to force his way back into the Test set-up after last featuring at the international level during the last Ashes tour for England in Australia. Surrey is set to begin their campaign at Glamorgan on April 19 and will play Oxford MCCU in a MCC University match on Sunday.

Relegation-threatened Romanian club Ceahlaul Piatra Neamt have sacked Brazilian coach Ze Maria for the second time in a week after being fired on Wednesday and reinstated the next day. The 41-year-old former Inter Milan and Parma right back was fired again after Ceahlaul were beaten 2-0 by FC Botosani on Saturday. Ze Maria will be replaced by Serbian Vanya Radinovic.

Radamel Falcao’s former Monaco team-mate Nabil Dirar believes Falcao regrets his failed loan move to Manchester United, where he has struggled to regain his form after a serious knee injury. Although Falcao was not happy in France, Dirar believes Falcao would have been better off staying at Monaco. United will have to pay £46million to make Falcao's transfer permanent, but they are unlikely to take up that option after he has only scored four goals all season.

A man wearing a 'distinctive' cartoon mask robbed a Christchurch dairy, taking the till and about $1500 in cash. The robbery occurred on Saturday at approximately 12:30 pm. The offender is described as 'very tall' and was wearing a fluoro orange sweatshirt. Police are asking anyone with information to call Crimestoppers on 0800 555 111 or to message police online.

Kaitlyn Granado, 24, a Texas math teacher, was arrested on March 19 for having an inappropriate relationship with a 15-year-old student. She was arrested again on Monday after another 15-year-old pupil accused Granado of having sex with him on two consecutive nights in January in her car. She was booked into Irving County Jail and released after posting a $50,000 bail. School officials put her on administrative leave, preventing her from working with students and being on school property.

A video of a crocodile swimming through a public marina in Puerto Vallarta, Mexico, with a dead dog in its jaws has been viewed more than 500,000 times online. Tim Weston, a New Zealander on holiday, witnessed the event and explained that the dog belonged to a local bike shop owner. Crocodiles are common in Puerto Vallarta, living in a nearby sanctuary and the mangroves. Social media users have reacted in horror to the video.

Steve Bruce is confident he can keep Hull City in the Premier League this season despite a 2-0 defeat by Southampton. Hull has six games to save their season, including fixtures against Liverpool, Arsenal, Tottenham, and Manchester United. Bruce believes they have struggled due to several long-term injuries to key players. Southampton moved up to fifth in the table after the match. Ronald Koeman, Southampton's manager, will speak to his squad to remind them that team rules cannot be broken by anyone after Sadio Mane tried to take the penalty when Ward-Prowse was first-choice.

Ian Guffick, a teacher at Mitton Manor Primary School, was banned from the classroom after he and his pupils altered exam answers outside of test conditions. An investigation by the local education authority resulted in the Department for Education annulling all SATs exam results for the entire school. Guffick admitted to the allegations and was banned from the classroom for at least two years.

Anders Lindegaard, Manchester United goalkeeper, has been married to Swedish model Misse Beqiri since last year, and they have a son together. Lindegaard has struggled for playing time since joining the Premier League in 2010. Beqiri, who has Albanian roots, regularly posts modeling photos on her Instagram page. Lindegaard was linked with a move to FC Midtjylland, but the two clubs could not agree on a price.

The 13 letters that once lit the Bronx from above Yankee Stadium, expected to bring in $300,000 to $600,000, did not find a buyer at a Sotheby's auction on Wednesday. Yankee Hall of Famer Reggie Jackson, the current owner, purchased the 10-feet-tall letters after the stadium's final game in 2008. The letters had been atop Yankee Stadium since 1976. A New York Mets bullpen car from the late 60s, estimated at $20,000 to $30,000, had a winning bid of $112,500.

Brendan Rodgers, Liverpool manager, spoke to Raheem Sterling and Jordon Ibe about their professional responsibilities, reminding them that as elite sportspeople, there are things they can and cannot be doing. Rodgers will not discipline either player. Steven Gerrard is available for the FA Cup semi-final after a three-match suspension, but Rodgers has not revealed whether he will recall Gerrard for Sunday's clash against Aston Villa. Rodgers believes that losing is part of the journey to winning.

Mesut Ozil posted a picture on Twitter relaxing with his dog after returning home to London. Ozil impressed on international duty as Germany beat Georgia 2-0 in a Euro 2016 qualifier on Sunday. He has been in fine form since returning from injury, wracking up four assists and scoring three goals since January. The former Schalke man says he is finally adjusting to English football, claiming he fits in 'perfectly'.

Barcelona club president Josep Maria Bartomeu says the La Liga leaders have no plans to replace Luis Enrique and are 'very happy' with him. Enrique signed a two-year-deal last summer and is concentrating on La Liga. Bartomeu refuted claims that Enrique will be replaced in the summer and says he's impressed with how the manager has performed. Enrique's side defeated Champions League chasing Valencia on Saturday, with goals from Luis Suarez and Lionel Messi.

Jordan Henderson has agreed to a new long-term contract with Liverpool, worth around £100,000 a week and running until 2020. He is the third player in Brendan Rodgers' squad to agree to a contract extension, following Daniel Sturridge and Philippe Coutinho. Henderson has contributed 13 assists and seven goals from midfield and will be considered for the role of club captain when Steven Gerrard moves to LA Galaxy. Talks with Raheem Sterling are not expected to resume until the end of the season.

Filipe Luis, who signed a three-year contract with Chelsea, wants to stay at the club until the end of his contract, despite Atletico Madrid considering bringing him back. Luis played in Brazil’s friendly wins against France and Chile. Chelsea manager Jose Mourinho is focused on winning every game and has prepared the team for the difficult games ahead.

Nathan Hughes's three-match ban for accidentally knocking out George North on March 27 was overturned on appeal. Initially, a disciplinary panel ruled Hughes was ‘reckless’ and showed him a red card, but the dismissal has been rescinded. Hughes missed his side's Champions Cup quarter-final loss against Toulon. Jeremy Summers, chairman of the appeal hearing panel, said the panel concluded that no act of foul play took place and that the incident occurred accidentally.

Tim Durkan photographed a fiery sunset in Washington, caused by raging wildfires in Siberia. The fires, started by farmers burning grass, grew out of control due to strong winds and destroyed dozens of villages. Smoke from the fires traveled across the Pacific Ocean to the Pacific Northwest, resulting in intense red sunsets because smoke particles filter out shorter wavelength colors from sunlight.

Becky Schoenig’s brand new 2015 Ford Fusion was stolen from her driveway and later returned with new red rims and detailing, red detailing on the sides, and orange accents on the steering wheel. Schoenig took to Facebook to thank the car thieves for “pimping out” her vehicle. She is getting the vehicle professionally cleaned due to the strong smell of cigarettes and marijuana. She is also creating a smoothie at her restaurant, The Hot Pot, to honor Mick Sexton, the man who located her car and notified police.

Manchester City players, including Sergio Aguero, David Silva, Joe Hart, and Yaya Toure, will lose £500,000-a-man in bonuses if they fail to qualify for the Champions League. The team is on incentivized contracts to stay within financial fairplay rules, and the squad has around £12 million resting on reaching their European target. The top three Premier League finishers qualify automatically for the Champions League, while the fourth-place team must win a qualifying round. Manager Manuel Pellegrini admitted the team has let their season disintegrate after starting 2015 joint-top with Chelsea.

Manchester United's Under 18s defeated City 1-0 in the 'mini-derby' at Altrincham's Moss Lane, with Callum Gribbin scoring the winning goal with a free-kick. The match featured a significant number of English players, with 10 being Mancunian. The victory leaves United two points behind leaders Middlesbrough with a game in hand, while City has lost both matches in the Barclays Under 18s Premier League end-of-season play-off series.

England and Manchester City goalkeeper Joe Hart praised fellow goalkeeper Gianluigi Buffon, calling him a "legend of the game" and an inspiration. Buffon won his 147th cap against England on Tuesday night, while Hart represented his country for the 50th time. Hart said he wants to "keep going" and "rack them up."

Chipotle has partnered with the Postmates app to offer delivery for online and mobile orders in 67 cities, tapping into the $70 billion food delivery market. A 9% service charge will be added to orders, with Postmates delivery fees starting at $5 and increasing based on distance and demand. Other franchises looking to capitalize on the delivery market include Starbucks, Taco Bell, McDonald's, and Burger King.

Bill and Denise Richard, parents of the youngest victim of the Boston Marathon bombings, are urging the Justice Department to drop the death penalty for Dzhokhar Tsarnaev, who was convicted in the case. They want the defendant to spend the rest of his life in prison without the possibility of release and waive all rights to appeal. The Richards believe that pursuing the death penalty could bring years of appeals and prolong reliving the most painful day of their lives. Martin Richard, their 8-year-old son, and two others were killed, and over 200 people were wounded when bombs went off at the finish line on April 15, 2013.

A custom-built Boeing 747, costing £400 million, has been converted into a luxury home for a billionaire. It features bedrooms, multiple lounges, a dining room with an adjoining kitchen, and an ‘aeroloft’ with eight full beds. Greenpoint Technologies depicted the custom-built Boeing 747-8 with a lounge, master bedroom, conference room, and office or guest bedroom. The plane can carry dozens of guests, despite being built for a single tycoon.

SpaceX launched a two-stage Falcon 9 rocket carrying an uncrewed cargo spacecraft, Dragon, from Cape Canaveral, Florida, to the International Space Station. The Dragon will dock with the space station to deliver over 4,300 pounds of supplies and will return to Earth with over 3,000 pounds of science experiments and other items. SpaceX attempted to land a rocket stage on a floating barge for the first time, but the rocket landed too hard for survival. This is the sixth SpaceX mission to the International Space Station.

Priscilla Presley will serve as a witness at the first wedding to be held at Elvis Presley’s Graceland Wedding Chapel inside the Westgate Hotel on Thursday, April 23. The winning couple will win a free wedding reception, a hotel suite for two nights, airfares, and concert tickets to the Elvis Experience theater show. Couples wanting to wed at the chapel must submit a video or photos along with an explanation detailing why they deserve the prize.

Jordan Henderson believes Liverpool could catch Manchester City in the Barclays Premier League. In the 2-0 win over Newcastle United, Henderson and Simon Mignolet played their 47th game of the season. Raheem Sterling scored in the ninth minute, and Joe Allen scored his first Anfield goal with 20 minutes to go, giving Liverpool a two-goal cushion. Allen admitted that Newcastle had a strong shout for a penalty when Dejan Lovren appeared to foul Ayoze Perez.

Roma defeated Napoli, ending their four-month winless streak at home. Miralem Pjanic scored in the 25th minute, and goalkeeper Morgan de Sanctis made several saves to secure the victory. Roma hadn't won at home since November 30. Napoli extended their winless streak to five matches. Security was tight for the match, with 1,000 police officers maintaining order, and there were no reported problems.
Doncaster Rovers and Fleetwood Town played a goalless draw at the Keepmoat Stadium. The match highlights on the club's YouTube channel were only 27 seconds long, with 14 seconds of match action.

Roland Giroux captured his remarkable relationship with his blood parrot cichlid on camera. He gently cups the fish with his hand and massages it. The fish swims away a few times but returns to be massaged. Eventually, the fish enjoyed being stroked and would become frustrated if Mr. Giroux didn’t play with it on a daily basis for at least 15 minutes each day. The blood parrot cichlid was first bred in Taiwan around 1986.

When Ben Stokes first turned up at the Kensington Oval, someone would have reminded him of the locker he broke his wrist on. Stokes has a fiery character, demonstrated by his clash with Marlon Samuels. Coach Peter Moores advised Stokes on how to respond, which he did positively. Stokes's aggression needs to be controlled, and he should be allowed to express his natural exuberance while being reined in occasionally. England wants Stokes and Chris Jordan to play as much as possible to help them grow into the international game.

Wales' Euro 2016 qualifier with Belgium on June 12 is a 33,000 sell-out. Wales and Belgium both have 11 points from five games, with Belgium on top due to superior goal difference. Wales' 3-0 victory in Israel has increased expectations that they can claim one of the two automatic qualifying spots and make it to the 2016 finals in France. The Football Association of Wales stated that general admission tickets for the match between Wales and Belgium at the Cardiff City Stadium have sold out due to overwhelming demand.

England coach John Peacock has named his squad for next month's UEFA European Under-17 Championship in Bulgaria. The Young Lions are the defending champions and will open their campaign against Italy on May 7. They have been placed in Group D alongside Holland, Italy, and the Republic of Ireland. The squad includes players from Premier League clubs, such as Jay Dasilva and Ike Ugbo of Chelsea, and Chris Willock and Stephy Mavididi of Arsenal. Liverpool pair Herbie Kane and Trent Arnold have earned a recall after missing the Elite Round of qualifiers. England's other matches are against Holland on May 10 and Ireland on May 13.

Manchester City are eager to sign 14-year-old playmaker Evangelos Patoulidis from Anderlecht and have held discussions with Anderlecht chairman Roger Vanden Stock to agree on a compensation package. Regarded as one of the best talents from Anderlecht's youth set-up, Patoulidis has also attracted attention from Arsenal and Barcelona.

Vanessa Santillan, a 33-year-old transgender escort from Mexico, was found dead in a flat in Fulham, London, on March 28. She died as a result of head and neck injuries. A 23-year-old man was arrested in connection with her death but has been bailed. Police are appealing to anyone who may have had contact with Miss Santillan in the hours before her death.

Dawn, who has had seven miscarriages, was furious to discover her friend Jamie had stolen £207 set aside for a £500 gravestone for her baby, Daniel James. A lie detector test revealed that Jamie, who has been to prison for burglary, had taken the cash. Dawn said she felt betrayed and was comforted by her partner after the show.

ISIS released more than 200 Yazidis, a minority group whose members were killed, captured, and displaced when ISIS overtook their towns in northern Iraq last summer. Most of those released were women, children, and the elderly or ill. They were received by Peshmerga and sent to Irbil. It was not immediately clear what motivated the release. ISIS previously released scores of other Yazidis. The U.S. State Department estimates that 500,000 Yazidis live in northern Iraq.

Harry Kane, nominated for both the PFA Player and Young Player of the Season, features in a new animation by Copa90. The video uses still photographs to produce an animated effect, featuring his goals from the season, including his England debut. The video is entitled 'Harry Kane - PFA Player of the Year?' and was released ahead of Sunday's awards ceremony.

Jamie Carragher believes Brendan Rodgers should continue to lead Liverpool despite a season with no trophies and likely finishing outside the top four. Rodgers' future has been questioned after a third straight season without a trophy. Carragher received a Beacon Award for his community work on Merseyside through his 23 Foundation, providing coaching in eight schools in deprived areas. He hopes to give youngsters a lift and that extra push to realize their goals.

Four-year-old James Hayward had his toy gun confiscated at East Midlands Airport after it was deemed a security risk. Security officers demanded he hand it over and performed a thorough patting down and inspection of the child. After returning from the holiday, the four-year-old boy was bought a replacement toy gun. East Midlands Airport apologized for the inconvenience but stated that their first priority is the safety and security of their passengers and that all regulations on security are set by the government.

A lonely man, 31, identified as “Rich,” living in Humpty Doo, Northern Territory, posted an advertisement on Gumtree seeking a girlfriend/wife. The successful applicant must love pets, enjoy the outdoors, and be a "princess when need to be." He described himself as athletic, white, heavily tattooed, with brown hair and eyes, and stated he doesn't drink, smoke, or do drugs. The position may offer a company car, phone, and laptop, and the successful candidate will get a free gym membership and a phone of their choice. Rich also stated that former partners need not apply.

FA chairman Greg Dyke wants to increase the minimum number of home-grown players in club squads from eight to 12 and change the rules so that 'home-grown' means having trained in England for three years before the age of 18 rather than 21. Five former England managers have backed Dyke's call, stating that failure to do so risks England falling further behind. They add that the pool of English talent is shrinking, which is a disadvantage for any England manager.

Demelza and Ross Poldark are now parents to a baby daughter. Demelza's pregnancy timeline was not convincing, with the last month passing in the blink of an eye. Fans noticed the fast relationship, commenting that pregnancies in Poldark times happen within 10 minutes. Elizabeth, another contender for Ross's affection, also had a fast pregnancy.

Leicester manager Nigel Pearson wants his team to remain focused on their own jobs and ignore their relegation rivals. After back-to-back wins, including last week's 3-2 win at West Brom, the team is three points from safety in the Barclays Premier League. Pearson stated, "Our future is in our own hands," and emphasized the need to ensure their own run-in is what they want it to be. He also mentioned it is important for the team to be in touch and that one of the potential problems they have to deal with is people being overly optimistic.

A North Pacific gray whale named Varvara swam nearly 14,000 miles (22,500 kilometers), the longest migration of a mammal ever recorded. Varvara left her primary feeding ground off Russia's Sakhalin Island, crossed the Pacific Ocean, traveled down the West Coast of the United States, and arrived at Baja, Mexico. Bruce Mate, the lead author of the study, said that Varvara visited "three major breeding areas for eastern gray whales." He also said that her ability to "navigate across open water over tremendously long distances is impressive."

On the east coast of Japan's Hokkaido Island, 1,000ft of seabed was forced to the surface overnight near the town of Rausu on the Shiretoko Peninsula. The land, rising as high as 50ft above sea level in some places, is believed to be the result of a nearby landslide. The mass measures roughly 1,000–1,640ft long and 100ft wide. Local residents reported no tremors or sounds to indicate the land movement.

Gregory van der Wiel has denied claims that he is set to leave Paris Saint-Germain in the summer and reiterated his 'love' for the club. He had a recent spat with manager Laurent Blanc after he was dropped. He told L'Equipe: 'I am genuinely happy at PSG. There is absolutely no reason for me to leave. I want to sign a new contract.' It remains to be seen whether Van der Wiel has any choice in staying with the club as Dani Alves is being linked with a move to the French champions.

Carlos Tevez has told Juventus to terminate his contract, which runs until 2016, so he can return to his former club, Boca Juniors. Tevez is the league's top scorer with 17 goals. Boca Juniors' president Daniel Angelici said they are close to sealing Tevez's return. Tevez's international manager, Tata Martino, told Italian paper *Tuttosport* that the potential move would not be a step down for Tevez.

Bayern Munich manager Pep Guardiola tore his trousers during his team's 6-1 Champions League victory over Porto. Guardiola joked he would need to buy new trousers for the next match. Bayern Munich secured a spot in the Champions League semi-finals with goals from Thiago Alcantara, Jerome Boateng, Thomas Muller, Xabi Alonso, and two from Robert Lewandowski. Porto had a two-goal lead from their previous 3-1 victory but were defeated by Bayern.

Three vehicles collided on the Brisbane Valley Highway, 2km south of Fernvale, involving ten people, including four children. A 40-year-old man, a five-year-old boy, a 27-year-old woman, and a six-year-old girl were flown to the hospital by rescue helicopter. Six others were taken to Ipswich Hospital with minor injuries or for further assessment. The highway has been closed off, with diversions in place south of Fernvale.

This weekend, second-placed Arsenal hosts table-toppers Chelsea in the Premier League. Arsenal playmaker Mesut Ozil received an Apple Watch, which he compared to Michael Knight's watch from Knight Rider. The watch ranges in price from £299 to £13,500 and will be released on general sale on Friday. Ozil has scored four goals in 25 matches for the Gunners this season. Jack Wilshere returned to the bench after five months out with an injury. Club legend Ray Parlour believes Wilshere is the future of the club if he stays fit.

Referee Mark Clattenburg will officiate the Manchester derby on Sunday and has sent off three players from United and City this season. Clattenburg has only sent off two players in the Premier League this season, both from United. Clattenburg will be joined by assistants Simon Beck and Jake Collin, while Jonathan Moss will serve as the fourth official.

MP Bob Katter accused the Queensland Government of believing embattled MP Billy Gordon was “a little black puppet on a string” after Gordon was accused of domestic violence and admitted to his criminal past. Katter's statement sparked criticism on social media, with users questioning his terminology. Mr. Katter has since defended the statement, saying he used the term "black puppet" in light of his personal experiences.

Dayna Dobias, a 19-year-old from Downers Grove, Illinois, was born with cerebral palsy. She creates videos of herself dancing to inspire others and counteract stereotypes about people with disabilities. Dayna says, "People tend to think that because I have cerebral palsy I cannot do anything and that I am so different from everyone else, when in reality I am pretty much just the same as everyone else." She has taken up motivational speaking at local schools.

Orlando City has expressed interest in Javier Hernandez, who has had a tough time on loan at Real Madrid. Orlando City has a huge Latin-American fanbase, and Hernandez would be a popular arrival. Eight European sides and several Premier League sides are also interested in Hernandez, with United willing to sell for around £8 million. Manchester United have made a revised contract offer to 19-year-old Andreas Pereira, who has attracted interest from several clubs across Europe.

At a 76 Station in South Los Angeles, a group of at least three people poured gasoline on a white Dodge Charger and set it on fire around 12:15 am on Saturday. The driver and two passengers were not hurt, but the car was ruined. The suspects attempted to carjack the driver before setting the fire. The Los Angeles County Fire Department is investigating the incident as an arson, and the suspects remain at large.

Charles Manuel, a southern Iowa chiropractor, surrendered his state license after admitting to exchanging services for sex and performing exorcisms on patients. He signed an agreement not to apply for reinstatement for at least 10 years and must prove that the circumstances surrounding the revocation no longer exist before resuming practice. Despite this, Manuel received positive patient satisfaction responses on HealthGrades.com.

The United States is complaining to Moscow after a Russian fighter jet intercepted a U.S. reconnaissance plane in an "unsafe and unprofessional manner" over the Baltic Sea. The U.S. crew believed the Russian pilot's actions were "unsafe and unprofessional" due to the aggressive maneuvers and high rate of speed. The Pentagon and State Department will "file the appropriate petition through diplomatic channels" with Russia. A similar incident occurred a year ago, where a Russian jet flew within 100 feet of a RC-135U over the Sea of Okhotsk.

An FBI agent's sniper rifle was stolen from a Salt Lake City hotel parking lot. The gun was inside a hard rifle case and was 'secured properly' to a truck safe with padlocks and chains. The thief stole the rifle by breaking the rear right passenger-side window, tying a rope around the rifle case's handle or a cable lock, and using the momentum from another vehicle to then break the case's handle free from the lock. The theft happened overnight on March 27. The sniper rifle has not been recovered. The hotel does not have surveillance cameras.

Luigi Costa, 71, is accused of killing Terrence Freebody in July 2012. Forensic psychiatrist Professor Paul Mullen examined Costa and believes his state of mind was declining, compromised by dementia and alcohol. Prosecutor Shane Drumgold suggested that Costa feigned his failing memory while being interviewed by Professor Mullin, who denied these claims. The jury can return a not guilty verdict if Costa's unstable mindset at the time of the attack can be proven.

Ross Barkley missed a penalty in Everton's 1-0 win against Burnley, despite Leighton Baines being on the pitch. Roberto Martinez defended Barkley's right to take the penalty, stating he is happy to have three or four players who can take penalties. Kevin Mirallas scored the only goal of the game after 29 minutes.

Two passengers were found dead in their stateroom on the ms Ryndam at 11:30 a.m. on Thursday. Holland America Line said the deaths appear to be a murder-suicide. The cabin was secured, and authorities, including the FBI, were notified. The cruise ship left Tampa, Florida, on March 29 and is currently in San Juan, Puerto Rico. The cleaning staff on the ship had discovered the deceased passengers.

Patrick Kluivert, former Holland forward and assistant coach, has led Curacao to the second qualifying round in CONCACAF for the 2018 World Cup. Curacao drew 2-2 in a second-leg match at Montserrat to win 4-3 on aggregate, with Charlton Vicento scoring the deciding goal in the 87th minute. Curacao will face Cuba in the next round on June 8 and 16.

Esteban Cambiasso has won all the major European competitions a player can. He says that keeping Leicester City in the Premier League would feel like winning a trophy. He signed for Leicester after ten years with Inter Milan, where he won 15 trophies. Cambiasso is happy and could stay beyond his current one-year deal.

Gemma, a 23-year-old mother of two children under five, faces being banned from seeing her children by her 52-year-old mother, Debbie. Debbie has been taking care of Gemma’s children since they were four months old. Debbie says Gemma's constant drinking and partying are getting out of hand, and she suspects her of stealing. Debbie says she will ban Gemma from the house because she can't trust her not to pinch their possessions.

Chelsea forward Eden Hazard scored, giving his side a 1-0 lead against Manchester United after John Terry made a strong challenge from behind on Radamel Falcao. Cesc Fabregas collected the loose ball and passed it to Oscar, who back-heeled it to Hazard. Sky pundits Thierry Henry, Jamie Redknapp, and Graeme Souness agreed that Terry's tackle on Falcao was a foul. Souness said, "It's a decent forearm smash."

A tour bus carrying Lady Antebellum singer Hillary Scott caught fire on a Texas freeway Thursday morning, but everyone on board was safely evacuated. Michael Barnett captured video of the fire. The tour manager told CNN affiliate KTVT that the bus stopped after a rear tire blew out, and it burst into flames after everyone had gotten off. The band is set to perform at the 50th Academy of Country Music Awards on Sunday in Arlington, Texas.

Dr. Adrian Quarterman of Dundee University is working on a laser that will convert sun beams into energy. Satellites covered in mirrors will orbit the earth, harvest sunlight, and convert it into laser light. The energy created can be shot back down to earth and could potentially power homes or restore power to disaster-hit areas. Initial trials in Scotland were successful, but Dr. Quarterman hopes to move the trials to Portugal.

A Los Angeles judge ordered V. Stiviano to pay back over $2.6 million in gifts to Donald Sterling's wife after she sued Stiviano. Shelly Sterling accused Stiviano of targeting wealthy older men, claiming Donald Sterling used the couple's money to buy Stiviano luxury cars and a duplex. Donald Sterling was banned from the NBA and fined $2.5 million after an audio recording surfaced of him making racist remarks to Stiviano.

Thierry Henry believes Arsenal needs to buy four top players—a goalkeeper, center back, defensive midfielder, and striker—to win the Premier League title. He questioned whether Arsenal can win the title with Olivier Giroud as the first-choice striker. Henry compared Arsenal's situation to Chelsea, who bought Thibaut Courtois, Nemanja Matic, Cesc Fabregas, and Diego Costa and are about to win the league. Giroud has scored 14 Premier League goals this season.

Maurice Van Ryn, a Bega Cheese boss, has pleaded guilty to 12 sex offenses, including persistent sexual abuse of a child. One of his victims stated that she is scared for her future relationships and that she didn't understand why she had been targeted. She said she hadn't spoken up about the abuse until she heard he had been caught and has since attempted to take her own life. Van Ryn is now in custody. The hearing continues.

Serge Gnabry, a 19-year-old midfielder, has not played since March 2014 due to a serious knee injury. He played 90 minutes for Arsenal Under 21s against Reading on Monday. Gnabry says he is feeling "better and better" and is looking forward to the next game.

Jacob Phillips, 23, fell to his death after running from a taxi to avoid paying the fare. He plunged down a 70ft cliff after leaping over a fence in the dark. Coroner Andrew Barkley recorded a verdict of accidental death, stating that Phillips likely became disoriented and did not know the danger that lay in front of him. Phillips was discovered the next day on the rocky beach by a dog walker and paramedics arrived at the scene.

Last summer, thousands of holidaymakers were affected by passport delays, but few received compensation. Ministers refused a blanket refund and rejected a demand by the Home Affairs Select Committee for all those left out of pocket to be compensated, stating, ‘It would create a precedent.’ Only 2,191 compensation applications were approved between April of last year and January of this year, with an average payout of £92.68. HM Passport Office made a surplus of £42.3 million between April and October of last year, and managers at the passport agency received bonuses up to £3,500.

A timewarp home in Horfield, Bristol, untouched for over 80 years, is for sale with a guide price of between £200,000 and £250,000. This collector's paradise includes original features such as stained-glass windows, oil-fired central heating, retro food jars, the original bathroom and kitchen, and wood-paneled hallway. The three-bedroom home also features original 1930s cupboards, a brick open-face fire, and a dated kitchen sink. The house will be auctioned on April 30 at the County Ground in Bristol.

Colin Kaepernick began his professional career as a backup to Alex Smith, but became the 49ers' starter in the middle of the 2012 season after Smith suffered a concussion. He remained the team's starting quarterback for the rest of the season and led the 49ers to their first Super Bowl appearance since 1994, losing to the Baltimore Ravens.
Soul Food is a 1997 American comedy-drama film produced by Kenneth "Babyface" Edmonds, Tracey Edmonds, and Robert Teitel. It was released by Fox 2000 Pictures.

Anne Rice was born in New Orleans, and spent much of her early life there before moving to Texas, and later to San Francisco. Route 495 is a 3.45 mi freeway in Hudson County, New Jersey, that connects the New Jersey Turnpike at exits 16E and 17 in Secaucus to NY 495 inside the Lincoln Tunnel in Weehawken, providing access to Midtown Manhattan.
Telemundo is an American Spanish-language terrestrial television network owned by Comcast through the NBCUniversal division NBCUniversal Telemundo Enterprises.

Damon Albarn, raised in Leytonstone and Colchester, formed Blur, whose debut album *Leisure* was released in 1991. Drawing influences from various genres, the band released their self-titled debut album in 2001 to worldwide success. Albarn's debut solo studio album *Everyday Robots*, co-produced by Richard Russell, was released on April 28, 2014, and featured collaborations with various artists.
Mogadishu, known locally as Hamar, is the capital and most populous city of Somalia. Many important national institutions are based in Mogadishu.
"Happiness in Slavery" is a song by American industrial rock band Nine Inch Nails from their 1992 EP, Broken.
Andrew Kevin Walker (born August 14, 1964) is an American BAFTA-nominated screenwriter.

The film *Shooter* (2007) follows Bob Lee Swagger (Mark Wahlberg), a Force Recon veteran framed for murder by a rogue secret private military company unit. The show *Shooter* stars Ryan Phillippe as Bob Lee Swagger, an expert marksman coaxed back into action after learning of a plot to kill the president.
*House* (also called *House, M.D.*) is an American television medical drama that ran on the Fox network for eight seasons, from November 16, 2004, to May 21, 2012.

In 1971, Charles Manson was found guilty of first-degree murder and conspiracy to commit murder for the deaths of seven people, carried out by members of his group at his instruction. He also received first-degree murder convictions for the deaths of Gary Hinman and Donald "Shorty" Shea. Recordings of songs written and performed by Manson were released commercially after he was charged.

Sean Justin Penn (born August 17, 1960) is an American actor, filmmaker, and political activist. He began his acting career in television, with a brief appearance in Little House on the Prairie (1974), directed by his father, Leo Penn. He received his first Academy Award for Best Actor in 2003 for *Mystic River* and a second in 2008 for *Milk*.

Sir Donald George “Don” Bradman, AC (1908–2001), often called “The Don,” was an Australian cricketer and is widely acknowledged as the greatest batsman of all time. After his retirement, he remained prominent in the game as an administrator, selector, and writer for thirty years.
L.A. Reid has served as the chairman and CEO of Epic Records and the Island Def Jam Music Group, and the president and CEO of Arista Records.

Brad Wilk was the drummer of the rock bands Rage Against the Machine (1991-2000; 2007-11) and Audioslave (2001-07). He co-founded Rage Against the Machine with Tom Morello and Zack de la Rocha in August 1991. As of 2016, he is playing in the band Prophets of Rage. Rage is a German heavy metal band formed in 1984 by Peter "Peavy" Wagner.

The multi-camera series *The Millers* aired on CBS from October 3, 2013, to July 18, 2015, running for 34 episodes over two seasons. CBS canceled the show on November 14, 2014, four episodes into the second season.

Dorothy Ann Willis Richards (September 1, 1933 – September 13, 2006) was an American politician and the 45th Governor of Texas from 1991 to 1995. She was defeated for re-election in 1994 by George W. Bush. She first came to national attention as the state treasurer of Texas, when she delivered the keynote address at the 1988 Democratic National Convention. Richards was the second female governor of Texas. Ann Richards (October 1, 1935 – April 1, 1982) was an American jazz singer and the wife of pianist Stan Kenton.
Bell released an EP in 2011 called A Reminder independently.

Boardwalk is a 1979 American drama film written by Stephen Verona and Leigh Chapman and directed by Verona. Janet Leigh was an American actress, singer, dancer, and author who wrote four books between 1984 and 2002, including two novels.

Simón José Antonio de la Santísima Trinidad Bolívar y Palacios (24 July 1783 – 17 December 1830), known as El Libertador, was a Venezuelan military and political leader who played a leading role in the establishment of Venezuela, Bolivia, Colombia, Ecuador, Peru, and Panama as sovereign states, independent of Spanish rule.

The Bermuda Triangle, also known as the Devil's Triangle, is a loosely-defined region in the western part of the North Atlantic Ocean where a number of aircraft and ships are said to have disappeared mysteriously.

Colin Kaepernick became the 49ers' starter in the middle of the 2012 season after Alex Smith suffered a concussion. He led the 49ers to their first Super Bowl appearance since 1994, losing to the Baltimore Ravens. In the 2013 season, Kaepernick helped the 49ers reach the NFC Championship, losing to the Seattle Seahawks.
Marnie is a 1964 American psychological thriller film directed by Alfred Hitchcock.

Advertising is a nonpersonal, audio or visual form of marketing communication used to promote or sell a product, service, or idea. It is communicated through mass media, including traditional media (newspapers, magazines, television, radio, outdoor advertising, or direct mail) and new media (search results, blogs, websites, or text messages).
Private Lives is a 1930 comedy of manners in three acts by Noël Coward. Private Lives is also a 1931 American Pre-Code comedy film directed by Sidney Franklin.

Maurice Harold Macmillan, 1st Earl of Stockton (1894-1986), was a British Conservative politician and statesman who served as the Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from January 10, 1957, to October 19, 1963.

Aristotle (384–322 BC) was a Greek philosopher and scientist. He joined Plato's Academy in Athens at seventeen or eighteen and remained there until he was thirty-seven (c. 347 BC). In 343 BC, at the request of Philip II of Macedon, Aristotle began tutoring Alexander the Great.

David Mordechai Packouz (born February 16, 1982) is a former arms dealer, musician, inventor, and entrepreneur. He invented the BeatBuddy, a guitar pedal drum machine, and is the CEO of Singular Sound, a music technology company.

Magic Johnson played point guard for the Lakers for 13 seasons. He was selected first overall in the 1979 NBA draft by the Lakers. He won a championship and an NBA Finals Most Valuable Player Award in his rookie season, and won four more championships with the Lakers during the 1980s. He returned in 1996, at age 36, to play 32 games for the Lakers before retiring for the third and final time. Johnson was a part-owner of the Lakers for several years and has numerous business interests.

Tenacious D, an American comedy rock duo formed in Los Angeles, California in 1994, consists of Jack Black and Kyle Gass. The band has released three albums: *Tenacious D* (2001), *The Pick of Destiny* (2006), and *Rize of the Fenix* (2012). In 1997, they starred in their eponymous television series and began supporting large rock acts.

James VI and I (1566–1625) was King of Scotland as James VI from 1567 and King of England and Ireland as James I from 1603 until his death. Both kingdoms were individual sovereign states, ruled by James in personal union. He faced difficulties in England, including the Gunpowder Plot in 1605 and conflicts with the English Parliament.

Big Brother 2017, also known as Big Brother 18, is the upcoming eighteenth series of the British reality television series Big Brother, hosted by Emma Willis and narrated by Marcus Bentley. Marcus Bentley is a British actor, broadcaster, and voice-over artist, most famous for narrating the United Kingdom's version of the Dutch reality television programme Big Brother since 2000. Bentley's voice-over work has led to him becoming one of Britain's most recognised voices.

The Free State of Saxony is a landlocked federal state of Germany, bordering other federal states and the countries of Poland and the Czech Republic. It is the tenth largest of Germany's sixteen states, with an area of 18,413 km2, and the sixth most populous, with 4 million people. The Saxony wine region is one of the northernmost in Europe and one of only two in Germany located in the former East Germany.
East End Park was a major league baseball park in Cincinnati, United States. “In the End” is a song by the American rock band Linkin Park.
Mel B. Brown released "I Want You Back" with Missy Elliott on Virgin Records, marking the start of her solo career.
Noah Cyrus is the youngest daughter of Billy Ray Cyrus and the younger sister of Miley Cyrus and Trace Cyrus.

Mohra (Pawn) is a 1994 Indian action thriller film directed by Rajiv Rai. It stars Akshay Kumar, Sunil Shetty, Raveena Tandon, and Naseeruddin Shah. Released on July 1, 1994, it became the second highest-grossing Indian film of 1994 and received nine Filmfare nominations in 1995. Raveena Tandon replaced Divya Bharti after her death. The film is also remembered for its songs.
"Hourglass" is a song by British electronic duo Disclosure. "Hourglass" is also the fourteenth studio album by singer-songwriter James Taylor.

Shane Black (born December 16, 1961) is an American screenwriter, director, producer, and actor. He is known for writing the 1987 film *Lethal Weapon* and for his directorial debut, *Kiss Kiss Bang Bang,* in 2005.
*A View to a Kill* (1985) is the fourteenth James Bond spy film. It is the seventh and last film starring Roger Moore as MI6 agent James Bond.
Papua, the largest and easternmost province of Indonesia, comprises most of western New Guinea. It was formerly called Irian Jaya and once comprised all of Indonesian New Guinea.
Augustus probably died from natural causes, although there were unconfirmed rumors that his wife Livia poisoned him.

Jennifer Lopez entered the music industry in 1999 with her debut studio album *On the 6*. In 2001, with the release of her second album, *J.Lo*, and her film *The Wedding Planner*, she became the first woman to have a number-one album and film in the same week. Her relationship with Ben Affleck influenced her third album, *This Is Me... Then* (2002). She subsequently married Marc Anthony and had twins in 2008. In 2011, she returned to prominence as a judge on *American Idol* and with her most commercially successful single, "On the Floor".

A working animal is an animal, usually domesticated, that is kept by humans and trained to perform tasks. They may be close members of the family, such as assistance dogs, or trained to provide tractive force, such as draft horses. They may also be used for milking or herding. Wild animals may be trained to perform work, but this is rare.

- Billboard Dad (film) is a 1998 American direct-to-video comedy film, directed by Alan Metter and starring Mary-Kate and Ashley Olsen.
- Top Latin Albums is a record chart published by Billboard magazine and is labeled as the most important music chart for Spanish language, full-length albums in the American music market.
- The Regional Mexican Albums is a genre-specific record chart published weekly by Billboard magazine in the United States.

Vedam is a 2010 Indian drama film in the Telugu language. It was written and directed by Radhakrishna Jagarlamudi and stars Allu Arjun, Manoj Manchu, Anushka Shetty, Manoj Bajpayee, Saranya Ponvannan, Deeksha Seth, Lekha Washington, and Siya Gautham.
*MIIB* is a 2002 American science fiction action comedy film starring Tommy Lee Jones, Will Smith, Lara Flynn Boyle, Johnny Knoxville, Rosario Dawson, Tony Shalhoub, and Rip Torn.

Sancho Panza is a fictional character in the novel Don Quixote, written by Spanish author Don Miguel de Cervantes Saavedra in 1605. He acts as squire to Don Quixote and provides comments throughout the novel, known as sanchismos, that combine broad humour, ironic Spanish proverbs, and earthy wit.
The Adventures of Pluto Nash is a 2002 Australian-American science fiction action comedy film starring Eddie Murphy and directed by Ron Underwood.
The world premiere of Hedda Gabler took place on January 31, 1891, at the Residenztheater in Munich. Ibsen was present.
Brazzers is a pornographic production company based in Montreal, Canada.
Timothy Simon Roth, born May 14, 1961, is an English actor and director.

Juventus Football Club S.p.A., colloquially known as Juve, is a professional Italian association football club based in Turin, Piedmont. Founded in 1897 by young Torinese students, including their first president Eugenio Canfari and his brother Enrico, it is the second oldest of its kind still active in the country after Genoa's football section (1893). The club has worn a black and white striped home kit since 1903 and plays its home matches at the 41,507-capacity Juventus Stadium.

Viola Davis played supporting and minor roles in several films and television series in the late 1990s and early 2000s, including the films *Kate & Leopold* (2001) and *Far from Heaven* (2002), and the television series *Law & Order: Special Victims Unit*.

Jenna Jameson (born Jenna Marie Massoli; April 9, 1974) is an American entrepreneur, webcam model, and former pornographic film actress. She has been called the world's most famous adult entertainment performer and "The Queen of Porn". She started acting in erotic videos in 1993 after working as a stripper and glamor model.
The New Orleans Pelicans compete in the National Basketball Association (NBA) as a member club of the league's Western Conference Southwest Division.

Starrcade was an annual professional wrestling event held from 1983 to 2000 by the National Wrestling Alliance (NWA) and later World Championship Wrestling (WCW). It was originally broadcast via closed-circuit television and eventually via pay-per-view. Starrcade events in 1985, 1987, and 1997 were the third, fifth, and fifteenth annual events, respectively, produced by Jim Crockett Promotions (JCP) under the NWA banner.

Jack Ryan Falahee (born February 20, 1989) is an American actor known for his role as Connor Walsh on the ABC television legal drama *How to Get Away with Murder*, and for playing Benjamin Stringfellow on the PBS historical drama *Mercy Street*.

Seohyun, a South Korean singer and actress, debuted as a member of the girl group Girls' Generation in August 2007. She debuted as a solo artist with her debut mini album, *Do n't Say No,* on January 17, 2017, making her the third Girls' Generation member to debut as a solo artist.

The Apple II is an 8-bit home computer, one of the first highly successful mass-produced microcomputer products. It was designed primarily by Steve Wozniak, manufactured by Apple Computer (now Apple Inc.), and introduced in 1977. Steve Wozniak is an American inventor, electronics engineer, programmer, philanthropist, and technology entrepreneur who co-founded Apple Inc.

A&E is an American cable and satellite television channel. It is the flagship television property of A&E Networks, a joint venture between the Hearst Corporation and Disney–ABC Television Group, a subsidiary of the Walt Disney Company. Both companies have a 50% ownership interest.

L.A. Reid served as the chairman and CEO of Epic Records, the president and CEO of Arista Records, and the chairman and CEO of the Island Def Jam Music Group. Reid also founded Hitco Music Publishing and co-founded LaFace Records.

Veeram (Valour) is a 2014 Indian Tamil action film directed by Siva and produced by Vijaya Productions. Veeram (Valour) is also a 2016 Indian epic historical drama film written and directed by Jayaraj.

*Home for the Holidays* is a 1972 American made-for-television horror film directed by John Llewellyn Moxey and produced by Aaron Spelling. It premiered on ABC on November 28, 1972, and starred Sally Field, Eleanor Parker, Julie Harris, Jessica Walter, and Walter Brennan. A 1995 film with the same title starred Holly Hunter, Robert Downey Jr., Anne Bancroft, Charles Durning, Dylan McDermott, Geraldine Chaplin, Steve Guttenberg, Cynthia Stevenson, Claire Danes, Austin Pendleton, and David Strathairn.
Taran Hourie Killam (born April 1, 1982) is an American actor, comedian, and writer.
*The Sex Factor* is an online reality TV series produced by xHamster where men and women compete to become porn stars.
John Hovig Dolmayan, born July 15, 1973, is a Lebanese-born Armenian-American songwriter and drummer.
Island Records is a British-American record label and a division of Universal Music Group (UMG).
Sikkim ([ˈsɪkᵻm]) is a state in northeastern India.
In 1983, Christa McAuliffe became a social studies teacher at Concord High School in New Hampshire.
Ron Weasley is a fictional character in J.K. Rowling's Harry Potter series.
Reign Over Me is a 2007 American drama film written and directed by Mike Binder and produced by Jack Binder. The film was distributed by Columbia Pictures and released on March 23, 2007.
Colin Rand Kaepernick, born November 3, 1987, is an American football quarterback and is currently a free agent.

Sheryl Lee appeared in Café Society in 2016 and reprised her role of Laura Palmer in the Showtime revival of Twin Peaks (2017). In 2016, Sheryl Lee Ralph played Madame Morrible in Wicked on Broadway.
Matteo Renzi (born 11 January 1975) is an Italian politician who served as the Prime Minister of Italy from February 2014 until December 2016.
The Road to El Dorado stars Kevin Kline, Kenneth Branagh, Armand Assante, Jim Cummings, Edward James Olmos, Tobin Bell, and Rosie Perez.

"Same Old Love" is a song by American singer Selena Gomez from her second studio album, Revival (2015). The album debuted at number one on the Billboard 200. "Same Old Love," along with "Good for You" and "Hands to Myself," topped the Mainstream Top 40 chart in the United States.
The show, Weekly Idol, is hosted by comedian Jeong Hyeong-don and rapper Defconn.

Heavy metal is a genre of rock music that developed in the late 1960s and early 1970s, largely in the United Kingdom and the United States. In the late 1970s, bands such as Iron Maiden and Saxon followed in a similar vein.
Ashton Kutcher appeared in romantic comedies, including Guess Who (2005), A Lot Like Love (2005), What Happens in Vegas (2008), and No Strings Attached (2011).

Topman is a chain of high-street men's clothing stores located throughout the United Kingdom and in Ireland. It is a part of the Arcadia Group, which also owns Burton, Miss Selfridge, Wallis, Evans, and Dorothy Perkins.

Development of the mining and metallurgical industries during the Industrial Revolution transformed Wales from an agricultural society into an industrial nation. Exploitation of the South Wales Coalfield caused rapid population expansion.
Tool has won three Grammy Awards, performed worldwide tours, and produced albums topping the charts in several countries.
YouTube is an American video-sharing website headquartered in San Bruno, California. Alexa Internet ranks it as the second most popular site in the world.
Sidse Babett Knudsen is a Danish actress, born on November 22, 1968. She works in theatre, television, and film.

Conrad Dunn began his screen career with the role of Francis "Psycho" Soyer in *Stripes* (1981). Several actors, including John Larroquette, John Diehl, Conrad Dunn, and Judge Reinhold, were featured in their first significant film roles in *Stripes*.
The film Raees stars Shah Rukh Khan, Mahira Khan, and Nawazuddin Siddiqui.
Asylum Records is an American record label founded in 1971 by David Geffen and Elliot Roberts.
Trollhunters is an American computer-animated fantasy television series created for Netflix by Guillermo del Toro and produced by DreamWorks Animation and Double Dare You.

The Armenian Genocide, also known as the Armenian Holocaust, was the Ottoman government's systematic extermination of 1.5 million Armenians, mostly Ottoman citizens within the Ottoman Empire and its successor state, the Republic of Turkey. Some historians consider the similar targeting of Assyrians and Ottoman Greeks as part of the same genocidal policy.
Marcus Morgan Bentley (born 4 October 1967) is a British actor, broadcaster, and voice-over artist.

Bill Clinton, an American politician, served as the 42nd President of the United States from 1993 to 2001. His first inauguration was held on January 20, 1993, on the West Front of the United States Capitol Building in Washington, D.C.

Danny Boyle, born October 20, 1956, is an English director, producer, screenwriter, and theatre director. He is known for his work on films such as *Shallow Grave*, *Trainspotting*, *The Beach*, *28 Days Later*, *Sunshine*, *Slumdog Millionaire*, *127 Hours*, and *Steve Jobs*. *The Beach*, a 2000 adventure drama film, was directed by Boyle, based on the 1996 novel of the same name by Alex Garland, and adapted for the film by John Hodge.
In the first week after the image of the dress surfaced, more than 10 million tweets mentioned it, using hashtags such as #thedress, #whiteandgold, and #blackandblue.
Major Bruce Middleton Hope Shand MC and bar (22 January 1917 – 11 June 2006) was an officer in the British Army.
Advertising is a type of marketing communication that uses an openly sponsored, nonpersonal message to promote or sell a product, service, or idea.

The film *The Others* (2001) won eight Goya Awards, including Best Film and Best Director. It was the first English-language film to receive the Best Film Award at the Goyas without a single word of Spanish spoken in it. The film won three Saturn Awards: Best Horror Film, Best Actress for Kidman, and Best Supporting Actress for Fionnula Flanagan. It was nominated for six Saturn Awards.
Ralph Fults (January 23, 1911 – March 16, 1993) was a Depression-era outlaw and escape artist associated with Raymond Hamilton, Bonnie Parker, and Clyde Barrow of the Barrow Gang.

The 14th Dalai Lama, Tenzin Gyatso, born Lhamo Thondup on July 6, 1935, is the current Dalai Lama. He was born in Taktser village, Amdo, Tibet, selected as the tulku of the 13th Dalai Lama in 1937, and formally recognized as the 14th Dalai Lama in 1939. The Dalai Lama fled to India during the 1959 Tibetan uprising and currently lives there as a refugee.

Set primarily in Italy during World War II, the film tells the story of four Buffalo Soldiers of the 92nd Infantry Division who form a bond with the residents of a small Tuscan village. The story is presented as a flashback, as one survivor reflects upon his experiences in a frame story set in 1980s New York.
Caroline Bouvier Kennedy (born November 27, 1957) is an American author, attorney, and diplomat who served as the United States Ambassador to Japan from 2013 to 2017.

The film Home for the Holidays (1995) stars Holly Hunter, Robert Downey Jr., Anne Bancroft, Charles Durning, Dylan McDermott, Geraldine Chaplin, Steve Guttenberg, Cynthia Stevenson, Claire Danes, Austin Pendleton, and David Strathairn.
Anne Rice was born in New Orleans, where she spent much of her early life. She later moved to Texas, and then to San Francisco.
Stephen Hillenburg was born in Lawton, Oklahoma, and raised in Anaheim, California. He was fascinated with the ocean and interested in art as a child.

A mendicant way of life is adhered to by many religious orders, including Catholic mendicant orders, Hindu ascetics, some dervishes of Sufi Islam, and the monastic orders of Jainism and Buddhism. A monk practices religious asceticism by monastic living, either alone or with other monks. A monk may dedicate his life to serving all other living beings, or be an ascetic who voluntarily leaves mainstream society to live in prayer and contemplation.
The Mod Squad was an American crime drama series that aired on ABC from 1968 to 1973.
The Dark Tower is an upcoming American film directed and co-written by Nikolaj Arcel. It is a science fantasy western action horror film.

Arizona is a state in the southwestern region of the United States. It is the sixth largest and 14th most populous of the 50 states. About one-quarter of the state is made up of Indian reservations, including the Navajo Nation, the largest in the state and the United States, with more than 300,000 citizens.
Smriti Mandhana, born on July 18, 1996, is an Indian cricketer who plays for the Indian women's cricket team.

Emma Charlotte Duerre Watson (born 15 April 1990) is a French-British actress, model, and activist. Watson was born in Paris and brought up in Oxfordshire. She attended the Dragon School and trained as an actress at the Oxford branch of Stagecoach Theatre Arts.
Angela Bassett began her film career in the mid-1980s after earning a bachelor of arts degree from Yale University and a master of fine arts degree from drama school.

The Congressional Space Medal of Honor, the highest award given by NASA, is awarded by the President of the United States on recommendations from the Administrator of the National Aeronautics and Space Administration. It is awarded to astronauts who perform feats of extraordinary accomplishment while participating in space flight under the authority of NASA.
The *Saw* films have grossed over $873 million at the box office worldwide.
Down with Love is a 2003 romantic comedy film.
Paul Nicholls is an actor best known for his roles as Joe Wicks in BBC's EastEnders and as DS Sam Casey in ITV's Law & Order: UK.
Colombiana is a 2011 French action film directed by Olivier Megaton and co-written and produced by Luc Besson.
Rick Yune was in the main cast of the Netflix original series Marco Polo until the series was cancelled on December 12, 2016.

Kentucky is known for horse racing, bourbon distilleries, coal, the historic site My Old Kentucky Home, automobile manufacturing, tobacco, bluegrass music, college basketball, and Kentucky Fried Chicken.
Filmed from 2002 to 2013, Boyhood depicts the childhood and adolescence of Mason Evans, Jr. (Coltrane) from ages six to eighteen as he grows up in Texas with divorced parents (Arquette and Hawke).
The film *Hush* (2016) was produced by Trevor Macy through Intrepid Pictures, and Jason Blum through Blumhouse Productions.
The Penibaetic System is the southernmost of the three mountain range systems of the Baetic System, located in the southern Iberian Peninsula.
Bonobos offers a full line of men's clothing and accessories. Topman, part of the Arcadia Group, is a chain of high-street men's clothing stores located throughout the United Kingdom and Ireland.
"Roar" is a song by Katy Perry, released on August 10, 2013, as the lead single from her fourth studio album, Prism (2013).
Saturn LLC, a registered trademark and subsidiary of General Motors, was established on January 7, 1985.

The Armenian Genocide, also known as the Armenian Holocaust, was the Ottoman government's systematic extermination of 1.5 million Armenians, mostly Ottoman citizens within the Ottoman Empire and its successor state, the Republic of Turkey. Turkey denies the word genocide as an accurate term for the mass killings of Armenians that began under Ottoman rule in 1915.

Muslims believe the Quran was verbally revealed by God to Muhammad through the angel Gabriel over approximately 23 years, beginning on 22 December 609 CE, when Muhammad was 40, and concluding in 632, the year of his death.

The human brain, along with the spinal cord, makes up the central nervous system. It consists of the cerebrum, the brainstem, and the cerebellum. The cerebrum is the largest part of the brain. Important structures located underneath the cerebral cortex include the thalamus, epithalamus, pineal gland, hypothalamus, pituitary gland, subthalamus, limbic structures, claustrum, basal ganglia nuclei, basal forebrain structures, and the three circumventricular organs.
T2 Trainspotting is a 2017 British comedy drama film set in and around Edinburgh, Scotland.

AMGTV is an American family-oriented television network that features programming consisting of drama, sports, movies, entertainment, how-to, hunting and fishing, children's shows, and other features.

Sir Donald George “Don” Bradman, AC (1908–2001), often called “The Don,” was an Australian cricketer and is widely considered the greatest batsman of all time. In 2001, Prime Minister John Howard called him the “greatest living Australian.”

Margaret Hilda Thatcher, Baroness Thatcher (1925-2013) was a British stateswoman who served as Prime Minister of the United Kingdom from 1979 to 1990 and as Leader of the Conservative Party from 1975 to 1990. She was the longest-serving British prime minister of the 20th century and the first woman to hold the office. She became the first woman to lead a major political party in the United Kingdom.

Randy Mario Poffo (November 15, 1952 – May 20, 2011), known as "Macho Man" Randy Savage, was an American professional wrestler and color commentator. He was best known for his time in the World Wrestling Federation (WWF, now WWE) and World Championship Wrestling (WCW).
Alice Cooper, born Vincent Damon Furnier on February 4, 1948, is an American singer, songwriter, and actor with a career spanning over five decades.

EA Black Box, formerly Black Box Games, was a video game developer founded in 1998 by former employees of Radical Entertainment. Based in Burnaby, British Columbia, Canada, it was later acquired by Electronic Arts (EA).

Baiae was a mineral springs and coastal resort on the northwest shore of the Gulf of Naples in ancient Italy. Herculaneum was an ancient Roman town destroyed by volcanic pyroclastic flows in 79 AD. Its ruins are located in Ercolano, Campania, Italy. In the immediate vicinity of Naples are numerous culturally and historically significant sites, including the Palace of Caserta and the Roman ruins of Pompeii and Herculaneum. There are famous ruins all over the world, including ancient Greek, Egyptian and Roman sites in the Mediterranean basin.

Tommy Lee Jones starred in *No Country for Old Men*, a film that follows a Texas welder and Vietnam veteran. Jones’s other notable starring roles include those in *Lonesome Dove*, the *Men in Black* film series, *Batman Forever*, *Under Siege*, *Man of the House*, *The Three Burials of Melquiades Estrada*, *Captain America: The First Avenger*, *Jason Bourne*, and *Natural Born Killers*.
Palo Alto is a charter city located in the northwest corner of Santa Clara County, California, in the San Francisco Bay Area of the United States. Its name means "tall tree".

Albert Lawrence Brooks (born Albert Lawrence Einstein; July 22, 1947) is an American actor, filmmaker, author, and comedian. *Finding Dory* was directed by Andrew Stanton, co-directed by Angus MacLane, and written by Stanton and Victoria Strouse.

Morse code transmits text information as on-off tones, lights, or clicks understandable by a skilled listener or observer without special equipment. The length of each character in Morse varies inversely to its frequency of occurrence in English. Morse code is less sensitive to poor signal conditions than voice, and it can be sent by improvised methods in emergencies.
Alexandra Anna Daddario, born March 16, 1986, is an American actress.

The 2005 Hindu Kush earthquake hit northeastern Afghanistan with a magnitude of 6.5 on December 12 at 21:47 (UTC). The Hindu Kush is an 800 km mountain range near the Afghan-Pakistan border, with its highest point being Tirich Mir or Terichmir at 7708 m in Pakistan.
As of 2015, Ripon College (Wisconsin) had around 840 students, the majority of whom live on campus.

Fox Sports is the brand name for a number of sports channels, broadcast divisions, programming, and other media that are either controlled or partially owned by the family of Rupert Murdoch. Murdoch and his family own 21st Century Fox and News Corp through the Murdoch Family Trust.
Wildfang is a US-based women's apparel company whose clothing features a tomboyish style.
Bessie Smith (April 15, 1894 – September 26, 1937) was an American blues singer.

Speech recognition (SR) is a sub-field of computational linguistics that develops methodologies and technologies enabling computers to recognize and translate spoken language into text. It incorporates knowledge and research in linguistics, computer science, and electrical engineering.
Aleister Crowley (born Edward Alexander Crowley; 12 October 1875 – 1 December 1947) was an English occultist, ceremonial magician, poet, painter, novelist, and mountaineer.
Poldark is a British-American drama television series that was first broadcast on BBC One on March 8, 2015.
Released on October 20, 1995, Dilwale Dulhania Le Jayenge stars Shah Rukh Khan and Kajol. The film was shot in India, London, and Switzerland from September 1994 to August 1995.

Tim Roth, born on May 14, 1961, is an English actor and director. Tim Roth, born on December 6, 1975, is the guitarist, backing vocalist, and only remaining founding member of the Canadian band Into Eternity.
In 1986, Tatum O'Neal married professional tennis player John McEnroe, and they had three children together.

Sean Penn won two Academy Awards for his roles in *Mystic River* (2003) and *Milk* (2008). He received his first Academy Award nomination and the Best Actor Award at the Berlin Film Festival for the drama *Dead Man Walking* (1995). He also directed the film *Into the Wild* (2007), which garnered critical acclaim and two Academy Award nominations.

The Earth's primordial atmosphere and ocean were created by volcanic outgassing. The Earth cooled, forming a solid crust and allowing liquid water. Plate tectonics shapes the Earth's oceans and continents. Human activity dominates the biosphere, impacting the atmosphere and Earth's surface, including the ozone layer, greenhouse gases, soils, and air and water. Water covers 71% of the Earth's surface.
Nuuk (Godthåb) is the capital and largest city of Greenland and the municipality of Sermersooq.

The film *How to Train Your Dragon 2* is written and directed by Dean DeBlois. The voice cast from the first film returned, including Jay Baruchel, Gerard Butler, Craig Ferguson, America Ferrera, Jonah Hill, Christopher Mintz-Plasse, T.J. Miller, and Kristen Wiig. Cate Blanchett and Djimon Hounsou joined the cast to voice Valka and Drago, respectively, along with Kit Harington.

*Down with Love* is a 2003 romantic comedy film directed by Peyton Reed, written by Eve Ahlert and Dennis Drake, and starring Renée Zellweger, Ewan McGregor, Sarah Paulson, and David Hyde Pierce. It is a pastiche of sex comedies popular in the era in which the film is set, particularly the three films starring Doris Day and Rock Hudson. There is also a TV series called *Down with Love* that was broadcast in Taiwan.
The album "Paris" incorporates elements of reggae, soul, and pop rock.

Stripes is a 1981 American buddy military comedy film directed by Ivan Reitman and starring Bill Murray, Harold Ramis, Warren Oates, P. J. Soles, Sean Young, and John Candy.
